summary: This is an email from an individual requesting travel arrangements for a work trip from December 15-17, 2019, split between Los Angeles for the Epstein case and Washington, D.C. for the case, with approval from 'Ed'. It details specific flight and train bookings and a hotel stay in Santa Monica.

events.title: Travel to Los Angeles for Epstein case
events.description: The email author travels from JFK to LAX for work related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Travel from Los Angeles to Washington, D.C. for case
events.description: The email author travels from LAX to IAD (Washington Dulles) for work related to the case.

events.title: Return travel from Washington, D.C. to New York City
events.description: The email author takes an Amtrak train from DC back to NYC.

locations: JFK (John F. Kennedy International Airport, New York)
IAD (Washington Dulles International Airport, Washington, D.C.)
Double Tree Santa Monica (Santa Monica, California)
keyFacts: Work-related travel for the Epstein case was occurring in December 2019, after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
The trip involved coordinated travel between New York, Los Angeles, and Washington, D.C., indicating multi-jurisdictional case activity.
The travel was approved by an individual named 'Ed', suggesting an organizational or supervisory structure involved in the case work.
The email specifically states the first half of the trip to LA is 'for the Epstein case', directly linking the travel to ongoing legal proceedings or investigations.
